data.title: 4: The Bollywood Remake Of ‚ÄòThe Godfather‚Äô ‚Äì Split Screen Podcast ‚Äì Podcast
data.meta_description: On this episode of the Split Screen Podcast, host Shah Shahid is joined by Sameer Dogra from the BollyCast Podcast, as they both gush over 'The Godfather' and its Bollywood remake, 'Sarkar'.SHOW NOTES... ‚Äì Listen to 4: The Bollywood Remake Of ‚ÄòThe Godfather‚Äô by Split Screen Podcast instantly on your tablet, phone or browser - no downloads needed.

Film and TV critic, Shah Shahid, provides his spoiler filled review of Stranger Things season 4, volume 1, now on Netflix. Deep dive with Shah as he takes a look at all the things that worked in this latest season of the Netflix hit original series.

HIGHLIGHTS:

üï∑ Shah's non-spoiler review here: https://blankpagebeatdown.com/stranger-things-season-4-volume-1/

üï∑ Shah takes a look back at what made Stranger Things work so well for Netflix.

üï∑ Which actor stands out as the one who stole every moment in season 4? The answer may be surprising.

üï∑ Does Stranger Things season 4 volume 1 live up to the legacy of its previous seasons?

üï∑ The longer episodes of season 4: hit or miss?

FOLLOW THE SHOW:

Subscribe to The Split Screen Podcast on Apple Podcasts or any of your favourite podcasting platforms. Follow the Split Screen Podcast on Twitter @splitscreen_pod.Follow Shah on Twitter and Instagram @theshahshahid.

Headline: Into The Woods: Netflix‚Äôs Aranyak Spoiler Review

Host Shah Shahid focuses on one of 2021‚Äôs best original series, Aranyak. The original Indian series is all about a whodunnit-style thriller involving a murder in a small town. Shah breaks down the story, its depiction and just why he considered Aranyak to be one of the best new series of 2021. Find out in this episode of the Split Screen Podcast.

HIGHLIGHTS:

üêÖ Is Aranyak based on a book or an original idea?

üêÖ The story of Aranyak takes the audience down some interesting avenues.

üêÖ Does the show do too much, are all the subplots perfectly balanced?

üêÖ How does Raveena Tandon do leading her own Netflix series?

üêÖ Shah‚Äôs Spoiler section discusses the season‚Äôs incredibly mind-blowing ending.

FOLLOW THE SHOW:

Subscribe to The Split Screen Podcast on Apple Podcasts or any of your favourite podcasting platforms. Follow the Split Screen Podcast on Twitter @splitscreen_pod.Follow Shah on Twitter and Instagram @theshahshahid.

On this episode of the Split Screen Podcast, host Shah Shahid is joined by the hosts of the brand new Bollywood Podcast, Jab We Pod. Rimjhim and Priley share their insights as the three review the brand new Bollywood Netflix series, The Fame Game. Being a show about a Bollywood celebrity, the series stars Madhuri Dixit, in her return to acting in a few years. But is The Fame Game worthy of her talent? Does the show work as a thriller set in the world of Bollywood‚Äôs star culture? The guests try to answer these and more questions in this spoiler-filled review of The Fame Game.

HIGHLIGHTS:

‚≠êÔ∏è Technically not Priley‚Äôs first time on the Split Screen Podcast‚≠êÔ∏è Priley and Rimjhim discuss their motivations for starting a brand new Bollywood podcast. ‚≠êÔ∏è What exactly is Jab We Pod? ‚≠êÔ∏è We review The Fame Game and whether it works as a thriller or not. ‚≠êÔ∏è Rimjhim is cautious of bad-mouthing Bollywood celebrities, but the show seemingly does that on its own?‚≠êÔ∏è Priley points out the good things about The Fame Game‚≠êÔ∏è Shah‚Äôs not too happy with how the show turns out, including the cliffhanger ending. ‚≠êÔ∏è The trio discusses whether the show works as a Bollywood story about Bollywood.

FOLLOW OUR GUESTS:

Subscribe to Jab We Pod at Anchor FM.

Follow Jab We Pod on Twitter @jabwepodFollow Priley on Twitter: @prileykwestFollow Rimjhim on Twitter @rimjhimgiresawn

FOLLOW THE SHOW:

Subscribe to The Split Screen Podcast on Apple Podcasts or any of your favourite podcasting platforms. Follow the Split Screen Podcast on Twitter @splitscreen_pod.Follow Shah on Twitter and Instagram @theshahshahid.

The long delayed Sooryavanshi is finally out! Rohit Shetty‚Äôs latest instalment of his cop universe of movies, feels like a means to an end, setting up other films for the director. Shah reviews this one to see if it was worth the effort and the wait in this Sooryavanshi spoiler review.

HIGHLIGHTS:

üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Shah looks back on his history with Rohit Shetty movies. üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Why Sooryavanshi is unlike other Akshay Kumar movie. (That‚Äôs a bad thing.)üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Does this movie have a purpose, or is it just setting up something else down the line? üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Shah discusses the outrageous and outdated misogyny of this movie. He has to calm down afterwards. üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The religious depictions of Sooryavanshi is damaging and irresponsible. üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The saving grace of this movie is very surprising and totally unexpected. üëÆüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Shah discusses if the movie is worth watching.

FOLLOW THE SHOW:

Subscribe to The Split Screen Podcast on Apple Podcasts or any of your favourite Podcasting platforms. Leave us a review and rating for more movie and TV reviews like this.

Follow the Split Screen Podcast on Twitter @splitscreen_pod.

Visit ComicYears.com for more of Shah‚Äôs news, previews and reviews on the latest from the film and TV industries.

Follow Shah on Twitter and Instagram @theshahshahid.

Dhamaka is the latest Bollywood movie on Netflix. It‚Äôs an official remake of the 2013 Korean film, The Terror Live. However, it‚Äôs a baffling movie full of plot holes that don‚Äôt meet any expectations of a drama, or a thriller. Host Shah Shahid breaks down all the things that don‚Äôt work about the movie, and one positive thing. So check out Shah‚Äôs spoiler review of Dhamaka, on Netflix right now.

HIGHLIGHTS:

üí• Shah provides a summary of Dhamaka. üí• Shah‚Äôs remake reviews of The Man From Nowhere, adapted into Bollywood as Rocky Handsome: https://audioboom.com/posts/6612738-split-screen-podcast-episode-12-john-abraham-tries-to-be-the-man-from-nowhereüí• Shah‚Äôs remake review with Kathy Gibson of Jazbaa, a remake of the South Korean Jazbaa: https://audioboom.com/posts/6612740-split-screen-podcast-episode-10-aishwarya-rai-bachchan-remakes-south-korean-thrillerüí• Why was Dhamaka made this way? üí• Shah provides some positivity about Dhamaka near the end. Too little too late?

Host and Movie Critic Shah Shahid reviews the latest Netflix original movie, The Harder They Fall. And how representation in this movie is such a big deal. This is a non-spoiler review.

After over a year of inactivity, Host and the least appealing part of The Split Screen Podcast, Shah Shahid, breaks down into a hot mess of self indulgent nonsense, in an attempt to restart the Podcast.

It's funny. But also sad.

Shah Shahid (@theshahshahid) is joined on this episode by long time collaborator and basically honorary co-host, Samarpita Dutta and first time guest, Nim. Together they review the latest Netflix Bollywood reality series, The Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives, as the ladies school Shah on, basically everything.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Why is Shah even reviewing a show like The Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives? Shah confesses the moment that made him tear up. I know‚Ä¶ everyone was surprised. Shah randomly asks Nim and Sam random questions about things he doesn‚Äôt understand about Bollywood.Sam teaches Shah what WAGs are. The girls run down the entire entrepreneurial empire of the cast of these Bollywood Wives. Shah uses the phrase ‚Äòspill the tea‚Äô properly. More schooling Shah on Bollywood gossip.More background on the inside history of Bollywood cliques. Who is the clear star of these Bollywood wives?Casting The Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives season 2.

WHERE TO FIND US:

Follow the show on Twitter @splitscreen_pod. Follow Shah Shahid on Twitter @theshahshahid.Check out Shah‚Äôs own site over at BlankPageBeatdown.com for his latest movie, TV and Bollywood reviews. Also find Shah‚Äôs thoughts on the latest geek, movie, anime and TV news and other articles over at Comic Years.

Follow Samarpita @lipstickpatrol and read her work over at BollyBrit.comFollow Nim @MapleBrownie.

Thank you for listening, and be sure to leave us a 5-star rating + review on Apple Podcasts.

Film Companion‚Äôs Suchin Mehrotra joins Shah Shahid to discuss the new Amazon Prime original Indian series, Made In Heaven, and breaks down the shows successes and failures.

HIGHLIGHTS: My non-Spoiler Review of Made In Heaven.Suchin‚Äôs Interview with Shashank Arora. Suchin and I discuss what they liked best about Made In Heaven.How Made In Heaven separates itself from the usual TV format of storytelling.Are the characters of Made In Heaven redeemed by the end?Did Tara cheat?We discuss how various forms of representation is handled by Made In Heaven.Is Made In Heaven ‚Äòclassist‚Äô or misrepresenting towards class issues in India? Suchin and I discuss why they enjoy Zoya Akhtar‚Äôs works, in comparison to other active directors right now. Find out what both Suchin and I agree is the biggest problem of Made In Heaven.Suchin‚Äôs round-up of Indian Streaming services available at Film Companion.Suchin breaks down how Streaming platforms are benefitting on-screen talent, as much as off-screen talent.

When a new Marvel Studios' movie releases, I, of course, have to be there front and center to watch the hell out of it. So here is my Movie Review of the first female superhero within the Marvel Cinematic Universe, 'Captain Marvel'.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Who is Captain Marvel? How does 'Captain Marvel' fit into the MCU? How accessible is 'Captain Marvel' if you haven't seen many MCU movies? I discuss how 'Captain Marvel' made me aware of a superhero trope that I didn't know existed before. My take on the strongest and most ridiculous criticism behind 'Captain Marvel'. Brie Larson is an absolute delight. We take Samuel L. Jackson for granted way too much. Ben Mendelsohn is the surprise take away after watching 'Captain Marvel'. I discuss what the most unnecessary aspect of 'Captain Marvel' was.

One of the year's best Bollywood movies comes to us in the form of Gully Boy, based on true stories of one man's aspirations to be more than they are. Check out my Movie Review on this episode.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Gully Boy is not 8 Mile.

Gully Boy is propped up by amazing performances and brilliant writing.

Ranveer Singh

you forget who Ranveer Singh is with this performance.

Alia Bhatt is wonderful in a role that's totally in her wheelhouse.

Kalki Koechlin

satisfactory in a brief appearance.

Siddhant Chaturvedi STEALS the show in a career-making breakout role! One of Zoya Akhtar's best movies to date.

DC Comics latest live action adaptation is the totally R-Rated Titans, which I totally watched and totally loved. So here is my Season 1 Review of Titans!

HIGHLIGHTS:

Breaking down what the Titans were in comic books and how this adaptation happened.

How appropriate is Titans for kids, and who is the intended audience?

What is the premise behind Titans?

How the marketing behind the series kind of screwed audience‚Äôs initial perception.

Why Titans works as DC & WB‚Äôs first R-Rated show featuring mainstream characters.

How Titans is nothing like the CW-verse of DC TV Shows!

For more about the CW-verse shows check out this episode of the Split Screen Podcast.

Brenton Thwaites is incredibly mature as Dick Grayson / Robin.

Anna Diop steals the show as Starfire.

Ryan Potter as Beast Boy is wonderful.

The world building in Titans is pretty insane.

Alisa Rivera returns to the show on this episode to recap the latest Bollywood news for January 2019, as we look at the latest #MeToo moment in Bollywood as well as the problem with ‚Äòstanning‚Äô favourites in the industry. We also gush about the Gully Boy & Ek Ladki Ko Dekha To Aisa Laga trailers.

HIGHLIGHTS:

Our last episode looked back at the #MeToo moments of Bollywood in 2018.

Rajkumar Hirani, director of P.K., 3 Idiots and Sanju is the latest to be accused of sexual misconduct.

Alisa & I react to the silence of Bollywood in this instance.

Is it really hard to separate the art from the artist?

I say ‚ÄòWoody Harellson‚Äô when I mean ‚ÄòWoody Allen‚Äô.

The real problem with ‚Äòfaving‚Äô or ‚Äòstanning‚Äô stars we admire.

Is Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Hai To Asia Laga the Black Panther or Wonder Woman of Bollywood when it comes to representation?

We discuss the nuances of Ranveer Singh‚Äôs haircut in the Gully Boy trailer.

On this first recording of 2019, we take a look back at the year that was in Bollywood in 2018, recounting the biggest moments, the most controversial scandals, the greatest and not so great movies, as well as which new movie star rocked the year. Join Samarpita Dutta and I as we look at the Bollywood year that was 2018.

HIGHLIGHTS!

I catch up with Sam about what she‚Äôs been upto the last few months.

I ambush Sam with a special personal revelation and thank you.

We compare the Padmaavat controversy with the lack of issues with Manikarnika.

Check out Kathy Gibson and my Movie Review of Padmaavat.

We recount all the accused during Bollywood‚Äôs #MeToo movement, and wonder if it will have any lasting impact.

Who had the best and worst reactions about India‚Äôs #MeToo movement?

Sam gives economic reasons to why movies like Hichki, Sui Dhaaga, Badhai Ho, Stree, etc were so commercially successful in 2018.

Listen to Kathy Gibbon‚Äôs and my hate for Badrinath Ki Dulhania on Episode 29.

Sam‚Äôs amazing rant about the failure of movies by the Khans and ‚Äòrise‚Äô of others.

Find out who were the best debuts in Bollywood in 2018.

The co-host of Bollywood Is For Lovers podcast, Matt Bowes, joins Shah Shahid to compare the legendary Hollywood movie Chinatown, to its (apparent) Bollywood remake, Manorama Six Feet. We discuss how the remake modifies the pre-Los Angeles landscape into rural Indian setting while trying to maintain the essence of the original screenplay. Also Hindi to English linguistics, for some reason.

SHOW NOTES:

Shah confesses a dark secret to Matt about Chinatown.

Check out the Split Screen Podcast episode featuring Erin, comparing the remake of Parinda in Episode 14.

Matt shares the inner workings of his Podcast, Bollywood Is For Lovers, and the challenges & benefits of working with your significant other, and who does what on his show.

Matt explains why they are so adamant about legal content consumption.

Matt & Shah discuss the legitimacy of modifying cultural references when subtitling Indian movies.

Shah tries to explain to Matt why South Asians on a majority, aren‚Äôt fans of Farah Khan movies.

The Om Shanti Om was episode 42 of the Split Screen Podcast with KayFil.

Matt & Shah veer off the rails to gush about their love of Dune. Potential future podcast episode maybe?

Matt synopsizes Chinatown while staying away from the Roman Polanski controversy.

Matt & Shah compare the changes made from Chinatown to Manorama Six Feet Under.

A discussion on how Abhay Deol is not the typical star-kid and is a more well rounded and underrated actor.

Episode 10 of the Split Screen Podcast compared the Emma movie to the Bollywood Aisha.

How does the scandalous ending of both Chinatown compare to the adapted version in Manorama Six Feet Under?

Wanna know what Nawazuddin Siddiqui has to do with Manorama Six Feet Under? Find out near the end of this episode.

Matt & Shah fan-cast a bigger budget Bollywood remake of Chinatown with bigger stars and directors.

On this episode of the Split Screen Podcast, host Shah Shahid is joined by Katherine Filaseta (KayFil) to discuss the teenage rom-com She's The Man and compare it to its Bollywood Remake, Dil Bole Hadippa!

HIGHLIGHTS!

KayFil‚Äôs previous appearance on the Split Screen Podcast was to compare Hamlet & Haider.

She's The Man is teenage romantic comedy based on William Shakespeare's play the Twelfth Night.

Dil Bole Hadippa is a Bollywood movie based on She's The Man.

How would She‚Äôs The Man be different if it were made in 2018?

KayFil can‚Äôt tell the different between white actors.

How Dil Bole Hadippa fails as a remake, and an interesting movie over all.

The NRI effect of Bollywood movies made in the 2000‚Äôs.

Shah has problems!

Talking representation of gender and sexual identities within movies.

Is Shahid Kapoor prettier than Amanda Bynes?
